page.title: 08North Luffenham Postmaster
page.content: The Postmaster moved to the village in 1977 from Nottingham.Neighbouring shops had frequently been burgled and he did not wish to fall victim. Since 1977 he has seen a rise in the number of young families to N.L. He rises at 06.00 and his daughters deliver papers at 07.00.Shop hours are 09.00-13.00 and 14.00-17.30.Tuesday is half day.Services are:_ newspapers, petrol, developing films, shoe repairs, laundry, wine & spirits, fresh bread and vegetables and General Store.All services will be maintained if well supported.Tourists to Rutland Water boost trade during summer months.The Postmaster intends to stay as long as trade is good.The shop has provided employment for his daughter for whom choice of livelihood would have been limited.
